author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
review: The Great Gatsby, penned by F. Scott Fitzgerald, is a mesmerizing narrative of the roaring twenties, delving into the lives of the affluent and the allure of the American Dream.

author: J.K. Rowling
review: George Orwell's 1984 stands as a chilling warning against the perils of totalitarianism and the erosion of individual freedom.

author: Harper Lee
review: Harper Lee's To Kill a Mockingbird is a poignant tale that transcends the boundaries of time and place, resonating with readers of all ages.

author: J.D. Salinger
review: J.D. Salinger's The Catcher in the Rye is a seminal work of American literature that continues to resonate with readers of all ages.

author: Jane Austen
review: Jane Austen's Pride and Prejudice is a timeless masterpiece that continues to enchant readers with its wit, charm, and keen social commentary.

author: J.R.R. Tolkien
review: J.R.R. Tolkien's The Hobbit is a timeless classic that transports readers to the enchanting world of Middle-earth, where adventure awaits at every turn.
